intro: Trollius europaeus f. grandiflorus, commonly known as the European globeflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It features showy, yellow, globe-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a short, stout stem and basal leaves that are deeply lobed. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
